meanings.definition: Contrary to intuition or common sense.
meanings.sent1: It was counterintuitive to think that the shortest route would take the longest time.
meanings.sent2: The solution to the puzzle seemed counterintuitive at first, but it worked perfectly.
meanings.sent3: It was quite counterintuitive to see a cat chasing a dog instead of the other way around.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her stable job and travel the world was a counterintuitive move, but it brought her great happiness.
meanings.sent5: The idea of using ice cream to cool down a fever may sound counterintuitive, but it actually works.

meanings.definition: Not in accordance with what one would expect.
meanings.sent1: The experiment yielded counterintuitive results that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: His unconventional teaching methods were often seen as counterintuitive by his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: It was counterintuitive to see a penguin sunbathing on a tropical beach.
meanings.sent4: The decision to invest in a declining market may seem counterintuitive, but it paid off in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The concept of a plant thriving in complete darkness may seem counterintuitive, but some species can actually do so.
